intro: Acmispon junceus var. junceus, commonly known as slender blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant has trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds. It is typically found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
